result.execSummary:
The defendant Trystin B Reichhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Columbia County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample. AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs. Court granted possible expungement of case if defendant successfully completes probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Steven Sarbacker.

Defendant Trystin B Reichhoff in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 16CM165, 16CM302, 17CM452, and 17CM457. Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of 17CM457. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Cts. 2 & 3 Dismissed. 17CM452 Dismissed.  In 16CM165, 16CM302, & 17CM457 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. $453.00 costs in 16CM165 and $443.00 each on 16CM302 and 17CM457. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs. Court granted possible expungement of case if defendant successfully completes probation.
Pretrial 9/11/17 at 1:40 pm and Return hearing on 9/25/17 at 2:45 pm.

Defendant Trystin B Reichhoff in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  William Albert Appleton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 16CM165 and 16CM302. Atty Sarbacker requested this track with the other two new cases. State had no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 01:40 pm.  Return date scheduled for September 25, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on 8-11-17 at 2:45 pm. Br. 2.

Defendant Trystin B Reichhoff in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 16CM165 and 16CM302. More time requested by atty Sarbacker.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing set for 5-31-17 at 2:45 in Branch 2

Defendant pled No Contest to Count 1 in 16 CM 165 and Count 1 in 16 CM 302.  Factual basis are the criminal complaints; Court adjudged defendant guilty and ordered JOC.  Court dismissed Counts 2 & 3 in 16 CM 302.  Stipulation filed in 16 FO 124.  Sentencing set for May 31, 2017 at 2:45pm.  4:35
